prompt:
Simplify
\[\frac{\sec x}{\sin x} - \frac{\sin x}{\cos x}.\]Please reason step by step, and put your final answer within \boxed{}.
output:
Let's simplify the expression step by step:

\begin{align*}
\frac{\sec x}{\sin x} - \frac{\sin x}{\cos x} &= \frac{\sec x}{\sin x} - \frac{\sin x}{\cos x} \cdot \frac{\cos x}{\cos x} && (\text{multiply by } \frac{\cos x}{\cos x} \text{ to get a common denominator}) \\
&= \frac{\sec x}{\sin x} - \frac{\sin x \cos x}{\cos^2 x} && (\text{cancel out the } \cos x \text{ terms}) \\
&= \frac{\frac{1}{\cos x}}{\frac{\sin x}} - \frac{\sin x \cos x}{\cos^2 x} && (\text{write } \sec x \text{ as } \frac{1}{\cos x}) \\
&= \frac{1}{\cos x} \div \frac{\sin x} - \frac{\sin x \cos x}{\cos^2 x} && (\text{write } \frac{\frac{1}{\cos x}}{\frac{\sin x}} \text{ as } \frac{1}{\cos x} \div \frac{\sin x}) \\
&= \frac{1}{\cos x} \cdot \frac{\sin x
